Detailed Description

Manages all graphics settings related to the Flora.

Member Function Documentation

void FloraSettings::init ( DataSectionPtr  resXML  ) 

Register the graphics settings controlled by the envirominder.

Namely, the FAR_PLANE setting.

The flora density options are defined in graphics_settings.xml (or whatever xml file is set as the graphics settings file in resources.xml).

Below is an example of how to setup the options in flora.xml:

 *	<flora>
 *		<vbSize>
 *			<option>
 *				<label>	HIGH	</label>
 *				<value>	1.0	</value>
 *			</option>
 *			<option>
 *				<label>	LOW	</label>
 *				<value>	0.5	</value>
 *			</option>
 *			<option>
 *				<label>	OFF	</label>
 *				<value>	0	</value>
 *			</option>
 *		</vbSize>
 *	</flora>
 *

For each <option> entry in <vbSize>, <label> will be used to identify the option and vb_size will be used to set the size of the vertex buffer used to render the flora. Zero has the special meaning of disabling flora rendering. See Flora::vbSize().

FloraSettings & FloraSettings::instance (  )  [static]

Returns singleton FloraSettings instance.

bool FloraSettings::isInitialised (  )  const

Returns true if settings have been initialised.

float FloraSettings::vbRatio (  )  const

Sets the flora density.

This value will be adjusted by the global flora vb-size settings before it gets set into the camera.
